cite: Chung, D., Christopoulos, G. I., King-Casas, B., Ball, S. B., & Chiu, P. H. (2015). Social signals of safety and risk confer utility and have asymmetric effects on observers' choices. Nature Neuroscience, 18(6), 912-916.

data_columns.subjID: A unique identifier for each subject in the data-set.
data_columns.p_gamble: Probability of receiving a high payoff (same for both options).
data_columns.safe_Hpayoff: High payoff of the safe option.
data_columns.safe_Lpayoff: Low payoff of the safe option.
data_columns.risky_Hpayoff: High payoff of the risky option.
data_columns.risky_Lpayoff: Low payoff of the risky option.
data_columns.choice: Which option was chosen? 0: safe, 1: risky.
